lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: What brings you in today?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: I've been having some really bad lower back pain for about two months now. It's getting to the point where it's hard to do my daily activities.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Can you point to where exactly the pain is?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: It's right here in the lower back, kind of across the whole area. Sometimes it shoots down my left leg.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Does the pain go all the way down to your foot or does it stop at the knee?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: It usually stops around my knee, but once or twice it went all the way down to my ankle.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Did anything specific trigger the pain?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: I was helping my friend move about two months ago and I felt something pull in my back.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: On a scale of 1 to 10, how bad is the pain?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: On a regular day it's about a 5 or 6, but when I bend over or sit for too long it goes up to an 8.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Have you noticed any numbness or weakness in your legs?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: Yeah, my left foot sometimes feels tingly, like pins and needles.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Any changes in your bladder or bowel function?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: No, that's all been normal.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: What have you been doing to manage the pain?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: Tylenol and a heating pad. I also tried some stretches but they didn't help much.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: What kind of work do you do?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: I work in an office, sitting at a desk for about 8 to 10 hours a day.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Let me examine your back and test your reflexes.

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: It's starting to affect my sleep too.
